DOD:

  • microservice-network is used in all dockerized services
","comments":[{"deleted":false,"author":{"login":"ykoval","name":"Yulian Koval","$type":"User"},"textPreview":"

  Spend 8 points. Though docker swarm has it own embedded DNS server (maps only service name without its port) (https://collabnix.com/how-service-discovery-works-under-docker-1-12/#:\~:text=Docker Engine 1.12 runs it's,server embedded in the swarm.), in order to migrate from custom service discovery (that stores registered server name and its port), we have to hardcode service and its port in all backend-to-backend requests and in API-Gateway configs. Using default http port (80) and make requests without specifying service port is not a case, because you can't open port bellow 1024 port number without root privileges.
Decided to stick with custom service discovery (Eureka) and host network.

Description:

all services are dockerized and docker swarm has its own internal service discovery, thus, there is no need to have custom one

DOD:

  • all services use docker swarm service discovery on QA/STAGE/PROD envs

dev:

  • Multi-host networking: You can specify an overlay network for your services. The swarm manager automatically assigns addresses to the containers on the overlay network when it initializes or updates the application.
  • Service discovery: Swarm manager nodes assign each service in the swarm a unique DNS name and load balances running containers. You can query every container running in the swarm through a DNS server embedded in the swarm

DOD:

  • there is a component RestPage that renders:
    • one of 2 available PageLayouts: Details or List based on URL
    • EditFormDialog based on search params from the URL (via the interface of UrlStateAdapter)
  • the Payment page and Staffer page are using this component

dev notes:

  • The URL format is: /resource/:mode?searchParam1=value1&…
  • there are 2 basic types of UI layouts to render based on URL mode segment: all with DataGrid and details with CardLayout
  • there are 3 basic types of FormDialog to render: Edit, New, Delete — defined by search params in ActiveUrlStorage.
